normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Enhancement**

unnormalised: Ensuring robust quality control is paramount for success in today's competitive manufacturing landscape. A recent workshop at IIT Delhi on 25/10/2024 highlighted advancements in statistical process control (SPC) and Six Sigma methodologies.
normalised: Ensuring robust quality control is paramount for success in today's competitive manufacturing landscape. A recent workshop at I I T Delhi on twenty fifth October two thousand and twenty four highlighted advancements in statistical process control (S P C) and Six Sigma methodologies.

unnormalised: Experts like Dr. Lakshmi Sharma emphasized the importance of integrating QC from raw material sourcing to final product delivery, especially crucial given the complexity of Indian supply chains. "Minimising defects early saves costs down the line," she noted.

unnormalised: The seminar covered practical applications including case studies from Tata Steel and Mahindra & Mahindra, showing defect reductions exceeding 15% after implementing advanced QC measures. Techniques like Kaizen and Poka-Yoke, deeply rooted in manufacturing philosophy, were discussed. The focus was on empowering line workers to identify and rectify issues immediately, improving efficiency. A subsequent webinar is scheduled for 10/11/2024 at 14:00 hrs. Companies are advised to prioritise investment in QC, for long-term gains and customer satisfaction, referencing the "Make in India" initiative's stress on quality products by 2030. Continuous QC process monitoring should be practiced, possibly with a review meeting at 09:30 hrs every Monday.
